benchmark_details.name: WORLDREP (WORLD Relationship and Event Prediction)
benchmark_details.overview: WORLDREP is a novel dataset designed to predict future international events from textual information, leveraging large-language models for accurate annotation of complex multilateral relationships.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a reliable dataset that captures complex multilateral relationships and supports research in text-based event prediction.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Despite covering various international events, WORLDREP may miss less-reported incidents.

data.source: Collected from diverse global news articles using GDELT project links.
data.annotation: Annotated by domain experts in political science and international relations.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on expert-provided labels against predictions from the models.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores represent better alignment with expert annotations, indicating more reliable predictions.
methodology.baseline_results: Models trained on WORLDREP labels achieved higher performance than those trained on GDELT.
methodology.validation: Extensively validated through comparisons with domain expert labels.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data comprises publicly available news articles, no personal data included.
